message:
The cart is packed with groceries—some on the list, some not. You also notice a few fun or random items that weren't planned for. 

 Maddie looks both excited and a bit embarrassed.

Impulsivity 

 Sometimes, ADHD brains are drawn to novelty and spur-of-the-moment ideas. This can lead to buying items that seem fun at the time (like scented candles or a quirky snack), but it can also mean forgetting essentials.
Maddie's impulsive shopping choices can lead to fun surprises—like discovering a cool new snack or ingredient—but it can also cause overspending or forgetting essentials.
Here's how you can channel that spontaneity without losing track of your main goals.

Set a 'Fun Item Limit' 

 Choose one or two bonus items, but keep the rest of the budget for must-haves.
